result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Vaggalis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).
  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

EACH COUNT:  Pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Denying Request for Relief; signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Letter from defendant asking court to limit collection of prison funds to prison wages.
from defendant's mother; filed.

Defendant Michael J Vaggalis in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Michael J Vaggalis in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 16 YEARS, concurrent to Count #s 4, 5, and 6.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 8 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 8 YEARS.
Credit for 143 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 4:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 16 YEARS, concurrent to Count #s 1, 5, and 6.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 8 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 8 YEARS.
Credit for 143 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 5:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS, concurrent to Count #s 1, 4, and 6.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit for 143 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 6:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS, concurrent to Count #s 1, 4, and 5.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit for 143 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1, 4, 5, & 6):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims.
* No contact with the co-actors.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $185.38 payable to the victim, Jeffrey S., JOINT & SEVERAL with the co-actors, Anthony Antoniak (15CF7352) and Dillon Johnson (15CF733).  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Michael J Vaggalis not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared TELEPHONICALLY for the State of Wisconsin.

State needs more time for victim notification.
Case adjourned to 06-23-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.
Court Report/Sentencing Memorandum filed by Public Defender's office worker, Yulonda Anderson.

Defendant Michael J Vaggalis in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Michael J Vaggalis in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 4, 5, & 6:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 and Count #7 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Michael J Vaggalis not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 05-21-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Parties request a status conference date.

Defendant Michael J Vaggalis in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Michael J Vaggalis in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02 due to lower pending case.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
